answers.answer: Hi, sorry to hear that. Try to stay calm and rest as much as possible.I had preeclampsia with my first baby. Had to have emergency c-section at 28 weeks as my bp was 180/110 and baby wasn't growing.. You can't have vaginal with high bp unfortunately. I had a c-section.I wanted natural birth.. But obviously things didn't work out that way. Don't be scared of c-section. Its really quick, like an hour total. My recovery was pretty easy too. Started driving after about a week already. My baby had to be in NICU for a while. But if you are late term, just make sure you have some help at home if as you don't be able to lift your baby for some time.
Did they give you meds to try and control your bp? Some say they are dangerous and some say they had to have them

I had PIN pregnancy induced Hypertension that developed into pre-eclampsia. I was induced but due to the inability of docs to keep my blood pressure down and I was getting sicker it required a c-section delivery. Otherwise I could have gone "natural". It will all really depend on your body and baby. Stay as calm as possible and try to hold on.

For me it happened suddenly. My OB checked my bp during 28 week appointment and it was really high, so she sent me to the hospital. I got admitted right away, was given different meds thru IV for 2 days, but bp wasn't going down. So had to have c-section right then. Forgot the names of the meds though, it was all a blur..
I ended up in labor and delivery this weekend and my boy has arrived at 33 weeks. Its been a rough week but God is good!
Sorry you had to go thru this.. Hows the baby doing? Congratulations!! Everything will be ok! Just rest now, the doctors and nurses will take good care of your baby while you are recovering.
He is improving every day. Its hard leaving him there and coming home but I know he's taken care of.

question: My bp is crazy high and won't hardly stay down. The doc thinks I have preeclamsia. Anyone else have preeclamsia dn get to have a natural birth or did they do a c-section??
title: preeclamsia
